questions.question_text_1: Read the statements given below carefully and select the correct option. Statement 1: If an element that belongs to two different classes is styled externally using both the classes, then for the same attribute, it will acquire styling from the latest class in order. Statement 2: If an element having an ID and a class is styled externally using both its ID and the class, then for the same attribute, it will acquire styling from the ID selector.
question_texts: Read the statements given below carefully and select the correct option. Statement 1: If an element that belongs to two different classes is styled externally using both the classes, then for the same attribute, it will acquire styling from the latest class in order. Statement 2: If an element having an ID and a class is styled externally using both its ID and the class, then for the same attribute, it will acquire styling from the ID selector.

options.option_text: Statement 1 is correct but statement 2 is incorrect
Statement 2 is correct but statement 1 is incorrect

props.summary:
### Summary of Core Topics, Concepts, Principles, and Equations

#### 1. **HTML and CSS**
- **HTML Structure**: Basic structure of HTML documents, including `<!DOCTYPE html>`, `<html>`, `<head>`, and `<body>` tags.
- **CSS Integration**: Methods to include CSS in HTML, such as inline styles, internal styles, and external stylesheets.
  - **External CSS**: `<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="styles.css">`
- **CSS Specificity**: Understanding how styles are applied based on the specificity of selectors (ID, class, element).
- **CSS Properties**: Common properties like `color`, `background-color`, `border`, `width`, etc.

#### 2. **HTTP and cURL**
- **HTTP Requests and Responses**: Understanding headers, status codes, and methods.
- **cURL Commands**: Using `curl` for making HTTP requests and debugging.
  - **Verbose Output**: `curl -v http://example.com`
  - **Trace Output**: `curl --trace trace.log http://example.com`

#### 3. **CSS Specificity and Inheritance**
- **Specificity Rules**: How styles are applied based on the specificity of selectors.
- **Inheritance**: How styles are inherited from parent elements.

#### 4. **Entity-Relationship Diagrams (ERD)**
- **Relationships**: Understanding one-to-one, one-to-many, and many-to-many relationships.
- **Symbols**: Recognizing symbols used in ERDs to represent different types of relationships.

#### 5. **Jinja2 Templating**
- **Template Syntax**: Using Jinja2 syntax for templating in HTML.
  - **Loops**: `{% for p in products %}`
  - **Conditionals**: `{% if "i" in p.name|string %}`
  - **Variables**: `{{p.id}}, {{p.name}}, {{p.qty}}, {{p.price}}`

#### 6. **Python and Command-Line Arguments**
- **Command-Line Arguments**: Using `sys.argv` to access command-line arguments in Python.
- **Python Modules**: Importing and using modules like `sys`, `string.Template`, and `jinja2.Template`.

#### 7. **Network Latency and Data Transfer**
- **Latency Calculation**: Understanding how to calculate latency based on distance and speed of light.
  - **Speed of Light**: \(2 \times 10^8 \, \text{m/s}\)
  - **Latency Formula**: \( \text{Latency} = \frac{\text{Distance}}{\text{Speed}} \)

#### 8. **SQL Queries**
- **Joins**: Understanding how to join tables in SQL.
  - **INNER JOIN**: `SELECT DISTINCT G.GiftName FROM Gifts G JOIN Reviews R ON G.GiftID = R.GiftID WHERE G.Price < 200 AND R.Rating > 4;`
- **Filtering**: Using `WHERE` clauses to filter data.

#### 9. **IP Addressing**
- **IPv5 and IPv8**: Understanding different addressing systems and their formats.
  - **IPv5**: 45-bit address, 5 sets of 3-digit octal numbers.
  - **IPv8**: 64-bit address, 4 sets of 4-bit hexadecimal numbers.

#### 10. **HTML Generation with Python**
- **HTML Generation**: Using Python libraries like `pyhtml` to generate HTML.
  - **HTML Structure**: Creating HTML documents with `<html>`, `<head>`, `<body>`, `<table>`, `<tr>`, and `<td>` tags.

### Knowledge Graph 

```mermaid
graph TD;
    A[HTML and CSS] --> B[HTML Structure]
    A --> C[CSS Integration]
    A --> D[CSS Specificity]
    A --> E[CSS Properties]
    F[HTTP and cURL] --> G[HTTP Requests and Responses]
    F --> H[cURL Commands]
    I[CSS Specificity and Inheritance] --> J[Specificity Rules]
    I --> K[Inheritance]
    L[Entity-Relationship Diagrams] --> M[Relationships]
    L --> N[Symbols]
    O[Jinja2 Templating] --> P[Template Syntax]
    Q[Python and Command-Line Arguments] --> R[Command-Line Arguments]
    Q --> S[Python Modules]
    T[Network Latency and Data Transfer] --> U[Latency Calculation]
    V[SQL Queries] --> W[Joins]
    V --> X[Filtering]
    Y[IP Addressing] --> Z[IPv5 and IPv8]
    AA[HTML Generation with Python] --> AB[HTML Generation]
```

```mermaid
graph TD;
    A[HTML and CSS] --> B[External CSS]
    A --> C[Inline Styles]
    A --> D[Internal Styles]
    F[HTTP and cURL] --> G[Verbose Output]
    F --> H[Trace Output]
    I[CSS Specificity and Inheritance] --> J[ID Selectors]
    I --> K[Class Selectors]
    I --> L[Element Selectors]
    M[Entity-Relationship Diagrams] --> N[One-to-One]
    M --> O[One-to-Many]
    M --> P[Many-to-Many]
    Q[Jinja2 Templating] --> R[Loops]
    Q --> S[Conditionals]
    Q --> T[Variables]
    U[Python and Command-Line Arguments] --> V[sys.argv]
    U --> W[string.Template]
    U --> X[jinja2.Template]
    Y[Network Latency and Data Transfer] --> Z[Speed of Light]
    Y --> AA[Latency Formula]
    AB[SQL Queries] --> AC[INNER JOIN]
    AB --> AD[WHERE Clause]
    AE[IP Addressing] --> AF[IPv5]
    AE --> AG[IPv8]
    AH[HTML Generation with Python] --> AI[pyhtml]
    AH --> AJ[HTML Structure]
```

These graphs provide a visual representation of the relationships between the core topics, concepts, and principles essential for the exam.
